review_title: Does the most with the least

review_title: Good place to get a career in higher ed going

review_title: There are benefits as well as areas for improvement

job_title: Adjunct Faculty in Oregon City, OR
pros: CCC really puts time into retaining students and doing research as to why students do not finish their educations, for a community college I think this type of self analysis is really important. I also really love the community feel at Clackamas. I had the pleasure of meeting the new president Tim Cook who seems to really have the college's value at heart.
cons: I wish the work was full time since it is hard to live off part time work and makes it hard to find other jobs to fill the remaining days

review_title: Great School Excellent Place to Work
job_title: Academic Advisor Career Coach in Vancouver, WA
pros: Staff and students are fantastic.  The College administration works hard to include full time, part time and temporary classified staff members in on the strategic planning goals.  Staff go above and beyond what is expected of them and they care about their students.
cons: unfortunately many of the positions are temporary grant funded positions and it is difficult to get hired as a full time permanent employee as the competition to work at Clackamas Community College is strong.

job_title: Computer Tutor in Oregon City, OR
pros:
Flexible Work Hours - Worked around my classes
Good Supervisors - Handled any issues I couldn't take care of myself
Challenging work with friendly students
Downtime - Plenty of downtime between students during certain periods of the term
cons:
Paid Monthly - sometimes exactly at the end of the year and sometimes a few days before.
Limited hour availability - It being a student position, we were limited to a maximum of 19 hours.

review_title: Good Working Environment for Part-Time Instructors
job_title: Instructor, College Or University in Oregon City, OR
pros: In my experience, I've been treated very fairly as a part-time instructor. I've steadily gained seniority and haven't had any trouble getting the average number of classes that I like to teach each term.  My coworkers (both full- and part-time) are supportive and encouraging.  Great place to work!
cons: It can be difficult to gain a full-time position as an instructor if that's what you're looking for in a career. My department is pretty good about hiring from within, but the full-time positions are few and far between.

review_title: Administrative Assistant assisting new and returning students register and sign up for classes.
job_title: Administrative Assistant in Oregon City, OR
pros: I loved the atmosphere. There is excellent comradery. Training was excellent. The office culture was decidedly academic which contributed to the high-energy environment.
cons: The most difficult part of working here was the broad diversity of students. You have to be able and willing to work with young college age who are unsure of their future interests just as much as you have to be patient with older retired age who are unfamiliar with technology.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Oregon City, OR
pros:
Worked with and for the Veteran community.
Developed professionally and integrally as part of an organization focused on Veteran success.
Learned about the many issues Veterans face.
Helped Veterans succeed with school and other endeavors.
Was respected as a leader in the community.
Hours of operation were fluid based off of V.A contract hours.
cons: Working under a V.A contract, there were minimal opportunities to advance with applying to the college's postings.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Oregon City, OR

cons: I wish I was able to continue going to school and taking classes. I loved the Pilates class but the days and hours didn't work with my other classes and for work.
